STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 27, 2021
Audrey Williams-Burton
Samaritas - Southeast
Suite B
2170 E. Big Beaver Ste B
Troy, MI 48083
RE: License #: CB630201265
Samaritas - Southeast
Suite B
2170 E. Big Beaver Ste B
Troy, MI 48083
Dear Ms. Williams-Burton:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/21/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure:
Laura Mitchell
Annetra Bennett
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(a, b, c, d, e, f, j) Reason for the change
One out of eight foster care records reviewed did not contain the
information for this rule including all of the subtitle of this rule.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(i) For a child under 2 years of age, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 3 months
before being placed in foster care or a new physical
examination shall be completed within 30 calendar days
after being placed in foster care.
One out of eight foster care records reviewed did not document
that the foster child completed a well child examination for 15
months and 18 months.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(2) An agency shall have documentation from the medical
or dental provider of all medical and dental care received
by a foster child.
One out of eight foster care records reviewed did not document
that the foster child completed the dental work for the follow up
appointment that was dated in 2/17/2021 dental report.
4

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(6) Service plans shall be signed by the social services
worker and the social services supervisor.
Two out of eight foster care records reviewed did not have the
signatures of the social services worker or supervisor on the
initial service plans.
 One report was dated 10/15/20 – 1/12/21
 Second report dated 12/14/20 – 12/30 20
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Nine out of twenty -eight updated service plans (USP) reviewed
were not in compliance:
 One USP dated 3/31/21 – 6/28/21 was missing
 A second USP dated 12/8/20 – 2/24/21 was missing
 A third USP dated 4/8/21 -7/6/21 -7/7/21 was 1 day late
 A fourth USP dated 10/10/20 – 1/7/21 was approved
2/2/21, 12 days late
 A fifth USP dated 5/14/21 – 8/11/21 reports the report
status as in progress
 A sixth USP dated 12/31/20 – 3/30 21 -5/6/21 was 37
days late
 A seventh USP dated 4/12/21 – 7/10/21 – 7/16/21 was 6
days late
 An eight USP dated 10/15/20 – 1/12 was approved on
2/2/21 7 days late
 A ninth USP dated 4/13/21 – 7/11/21 – 7/12/21 was 2
days late.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
5

within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service
plan must address the living arrangement for the child or
children, visitation/parenting time with the youth's
biological children or a clear explanation why this is not
possible or appropriate.
Two of five USP service plan for independent living was not in
Compliance with this rule:
 One USP dated 10/9/20 – 1/16/21 – 1/28/21 was 20 days
late
 One USP dated 1/7/21 4/7/21 was missing
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.30 Supervisory Oversight (Commitment 66).
Supervisors shall meet at least monthly with each assigned
worker to review the status and progress of each case on
the worker’s caseload. Supervisors shall review and
approve each service plan. The plan can be approved only
after the supervisor has a face-to-face meeting with the
worker, which can be the monthly meeting.
Two of eight open foster child records reviewed did not show
documentation of supervisor/worker face-to face meeting.
Reports were 10/10/20 – 1/7/21 and 4/8/21 – 7/6/21.
6

ISEP 4.22 MISACWIS (Commitment 22).
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated child
welfare information system (MiSACWIS) which will be the
primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
Numerous case records reviewed did not show consistent
uploads of all signed and timely documentation. There were
unsigned USP’S, PATP’s, updated medical passports,
missing USP’s, and FTM’s.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
DHHS FOM Policy Family Team Meeting
722 – 06B
The following events shall trigger FTM for out of home
cases:
Updated case plan (USP) – within 30 calendar days
before the case plan due date.
Three of eight foster care cases reviewed were missing
FTM’s or the FTM were completed after the USP date.
DHHS FOM Policy Required Participation in Development – Foster Parent/
722.08C Pg. 2 Caregiver and Birth Parent.
7

The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required
and indicates that the foster parent/caregiver
acknowledges and agrees to the activities required to
meet the needs of the child in their care.
Signatures must be documented within 30 days.
Eight of twenty-one PATP’s reviewed were missing a
PATP or the birth parent and/or caregiver did not sign the
PATP.
DHHS FOM Policy MEDICAL PASSPORTS
801 Pgs. 11-13
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child’s current and complete health
information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
Legal parents, foster care provider, and all medical
and mental health professionals.
One out of eight case records reviewed one did not have
Documentation of a completed medical passport.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R400.12413 Medical and dental care policy. Contract
(1, i) For a child under 2 years of age, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 3 months
before being placed in foster care or a new physical
examination shall be completed within 30 calendar days after
placed in foster care.
One foster care record reviewed showed that the agency sent documentation to the
doctor’s office for completion of well child examination for 15 month and 18 months.
It is recommended that the agency obtain documentation when required services are
provided due to medical directives.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
8

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a CAP for Interim Inspection Report dated 11/10/2020. The
CAP was accepted on 11/25/2020. The agency is in non-compliance with sections
of the CAP, as the agency is in repeat violations during this current renewal
inspections. The agency was in non-compliance with the following interim
inspections.
 R400. 12327 Special evaluation
 R400. 12324 Reevaluation
 R400. 12413 Medical & dental care policy
 R400. 12418 Development of service plans
 R400. 12421 Visitation and parenting time
 R400. 12509 Independent Living record
 FOM Policy 722-06B - Family Team Meeting
 FOM Policy 722-09 – Supervisory Approval
 FOM Policy 08C – PATP
 FOM Policy 06I – Sibling Visitation
 FOM Policy 801 – Medical Passports
 FOM Policy 801 – Dental Examination
VII. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDING:
There were no safety alerts for this agency during this Renewal Inspections.
9

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Samaritas
Southeast will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
9/27/2021
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 27, 2021
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
10
